This tool allows you to transfer your bowling data to a new device. Your data will be uploaded to a remote server, from which you can later download it onto a new device. Currently, the data will only persist for 1 hour on the server before being disposed of. Note that this tool is NOT for backing up your data, but for transferring to a new device.\n\nTo begin, either export and upload your data, or import and download it.
Press \'Begin\' to upload your bowling data to the server. When the upload finishes, you\'ll receive a unique code that will allow you to download the data on a different device.

Welcome to your 5 Pin Bowling Companion!
Begin by creating a new bowler and leagues. Use the \'+\' button to create a new item, or press and hold on an item to delete or change its name.
You can create leagues or events. Leagues are a weekly event of 1â€“5 games. Events are one time only, but can be up to 20 games.
Record a game by tapping or swiping to knock over the pins you hit each ball. You can also add fouls, lock games and set match play results.
If you need to add a game after you\'ve bowled it, you can using the menu button while editing a game to set a score manually.
You can view statistics by tapping the "Statistics" button anywhere you see it. You can also tap a statistic to see a graph of it over time.
Finally, the settings menu is available throughout the app and allows you to personalize it to fit your needs.
5 Pin Bowling Companion requires the external storage to save an image of your game to the device.

It appears that you may have been affected by a bug in the application which has been fixed. This bug caused renamed leagues and events to have an extra "L" or "E" at the beginning of their new names. This bug has been fixed, and you should now be able to change the name of any incorrect leagues effectively.
